name: Puerto Rico
description: Puerto Rico, an island territory of the United States, boasts a rich history, diverse landscapes, and vibrant culture. Located east of Cuba and north of the Dominican Republic, it’s characterized by a mountainous spine, lush rainforests, stunning beaches, and a unique blend of Spanish, African, and indigenous influences. The island’s geological history, shaped by volcanic activity and erosion, contributes to its remarkable biodiversity and varied ecosystems.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The historic capital and largest city of Puerto Rico.
quickFacts.detail: San Juan is a UNESCO World Heritage Site, renowned for its colonial architecture and strategic importance throughout history.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: The population of Puerto Rico reflects a diverse heritage.
quickFacts.detail: The majority of the population identifies as Hispanic or Latino, with a significant African and European ancestry.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: A relatively small island with significant geographical variation.
quickFacts.detail: Puerto Rico’s terrain ranges from coastal plains to mountainous highlands.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: As a US territory, Puerto Rico uses the US Dollar.
quickFacts.detail: However, Puerto Rico has its own distinct financial regulations and economic policies.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: Both Spanish and English are widely spoken.
quickFacts.detail: Spanish is the predominant language, while English is prevalent in business and tourism.

quickFacts.label: Independence Status
quickFacts.description: Puerto Rico is a self-governing territory of the United States.
quickFacts.detail: The island's political status remains a subject of ongoing debate and referendums.

climateData.title: Tropical Climate
climateData.description: Puerto Rico experiences a tropical climate with consistently warm temperatures and high humidity throughout the year. The island is influenced by trade winds, resulting in distinct wet and dry seasons.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The summer months are hot and humid, with frequent afternoon showers.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Fall (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Fall brings a gradual decrease in rainfall and slightly cooler temperatures.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Winter is the coolest and driest season, with average temperatures in the low 70s Fahrenheit.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Spring offers a transition between the dry and wet seasons, with increasing rainfall.

naturalWonders.name: El Yunque National Forest
naturalWonders.description: El Yunque is the only tropical rainforest in the U.S. National Forest System, renowned for its incredible biodiversity and stunning waterfalls. It’s a vital source of freshwater for the island.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The forest boasts a diverse array of plant and animal life, including orchids, bromeliads, and the coquí frog, Puerto Rico’s national symbol. Trails range from easy strolls to challenging climbs, offering breathtaking views.

naturalWonders.name: Bioluminescent Bays
naturalWonders.description: Puerto Rico is home to several bioluminescent bays, where microscopic organisms called dinoflagellates emit a blue glow when disturbed. This creates a magical experience.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The bays are a delicate ecosystem, and responsible tourism practices are crucial to protect them. Kayaking or paddleboarding through the glowing waters is an unforgettable experience.

naturalWonders.name: Las Cabezas de San Juan National Monument
naturalWonders.description: This historic monument protects a significant portion of the island’s coastline and features a lighthouse built in the 17th century. It’s a crucial habitat for migratory birds.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The monument encompasses a diverse range of ecosystems, including mangroves, coral reefs, and beaches. It offers opportunities for birdwatching, snorkeling, and exploring the island’s maritime history.

biodiversityCategory.name: Endemic Species
biodiversityCategory.description: Puerto Rico is a biodiversity hotspot, with a high number of species found nowhere else on Earth. Many of these are endemic, meaning they are unique to the island.

statistics.details: Around 10% of the world’s plant species are found in Puerto Rico.
Numerous bird species are endemic to Puerto Rico, including the Puerto Rican Parrot.

notableSpecies.name: Puerto Rican Parrot
notableSpecies.significance: The only parrot endemic to the Caribbean, once on the brink of extinction but now making a slow recovery.

notableSpecies.name: Puerto Rican Coquí Frog
notableSpecies.significance: The national symbol of Puerto Rico, known for its distinctive call.

ecosystemData.title: Tropical Rainforests and Coastal Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Puerto Rico’s ecosystems are remarkably diverse, ranging from the lush tropical rainforests of El Yunque to the vibrant coral reefs of its coastline. These ecosystems are vital for the island’s biodiversity and provide essential services.

biodiversityCategories.name: Coral Reefs
biodiversityCategories.description: Puerto Rico’s coral reefs are among the most biodiverse in the Caribbean, supporting a wide range of marine life.

statistics.details: A diverse array of coral species contributes to the reef’s complexity.

biodiversityCategories.name: Mangrove Forests
biodiversityCategories.description: Mangrove forests provide critical habitat for numerous species and protect the coastline from erosion.

statistics.details: These forests are essential for coastal protection and fisheries.

activities.title: Outdoor Adventures
activities.description: Puerto Rico offers a wide range of outdoor activities for all skill levels.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore the island’s diverse trails, from rainforest hikes to coastal trails.

activities.name: El Yunque Summit Trail
activities.description: A challenging hike to the summit of El Yunque, offering panoramic views.

activities.name: La Mina Falls Trail
activities.description: A popular trail leading to a beautiful waterfall.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy the island’s pristine beaches and crystal-clear waters.

activities.name: Scuba Diving
activities.description: Explore the vibrant coral reefs and diverse marine life.

activities.name: Surfing
activities.description: Catch the waves at popular surf spots.
